actions.args: {"body": {"name": "DevHub Developer Relations Contributor report [08-04-2024 to 19-04-2024]", "summary": "Developing DevHub Developer News | Managing WG\\\\\\'s | Community Pages ", "category": "Decentralized DevRel", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "bpolania.near", "description": "## Summary of work\\\\n\\\\u{1f468}\\\\u{200d}\\\\u{1f4bb} **Mon 8th April 2024 - Fri 12th April 2024**\\\\n\\\\n**1. NEAR Dev NEWS:** Curating content for the newsletter...involving sifting through all DevHub Communities Telegram channels to filter relevant updates, engaging with moderators for reviews, sourcing additional technical updates from external channels, error checking, editing ,compiling and taking notes of improvements. **30H**\\\\n\\\\n**2. Marketing newsletter:** Setting up graphics, announcemnets and publishing newsletter : **1H**\\\\n\\\\n**3. Updating Community pages with new graphics** **1H**\\\\n\\\\n**4 NEP\\\\\\'s and WG\\\\\\'s**: Writing thread for promoting upcoming NEP on twitter , Announcements for Contracts WG Call #5, Working on setting up Protocol WG Cal #9, Streamlining announcements with Yoon for protocol community. **8H**\\\\n\\\\n**5**Updates to devrel community page (Quarterly Updates and Short write up on ETH Seoul)**2H**\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**Total hours: 40 hours/week Rate: $25 USDT per hour**\\\\n \\\\n \\\\n  \\\\n\\\\u{1f468}\\\\u{200d}\\\\u{1f4bb} **Mon 15th April 2024 - Fri 19th April 2024**\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**1. NEAR Dev NEWS:** Curating content for the newsletter...involving sifting through all DevHub Communities Telegram channels to filter relevant updates, engaging with moderators for reviews, sourcing additional technical updates from external channels, error checking, compiling and taking notes of improvements. **33H**\\\\n\\\\n**2. Marketing newsletter:** Setting up graphics, announcemnets and publishing: **1H**\\\\n\\\\n**3.**Preparing for Contracts WG Call . Setting up the deck and sending out announcements **3H**\\\\n\\\\n**4.**Writing recaps for the Contracts WG call **1H**\\\\n\\\\n**5.**Preparing for Protocol WG Call next week **2H**\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**Total hours: 40 hours/week Rate: $25 USDT per hour**\\\\n\\\\nBudget Breakdown\\\\nTotal hours: 80\\\\nRate: $25/hour\\\\nTotal amount: $2000", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "victorkanu1.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "2000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": []}

{"data": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"**GM protocol community,** \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nJoin us for the 9th NEAR Protocol Work Group call on Friday April 26th 2024, where the work group will vote on NEP-536 and NEP-540. Here\\\\\\'s a preview:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{1f5d3}[Add to calendar](https://bit.ly/protocol-wg-call-9)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\u{1f449}[NEP-540](https://github.com/near/NEPs/issues/540) addresses the pressing issue of the storage staking mechanism\\\\\\'s inefficiency and the significant increase in costs due to the rise in NEAR token price. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\u{1f449}While [NEP-536](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/536) seeks to enhance protocol efficiency by reducing the number of gas refund receipts and optimizing gas usage within the Near ecosystem. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThese NEP\\\\\\'s are in the final comment period. Dive into the technical details in the GitHub discussion and join the call to learn about the final decision!\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}, "handle": "protocol"}

{"data": {"protocol.community.devhub.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"**GM protocol community,** \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nJoin us for the 9th NEAR Protocol Work Group call on Friday April 26th 2024, where the work group will vote on NEP-536 and NEP-540. Here\\\\\\'s a preview:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{1f5d3}[Add to calendar](https://bit.ly/protocol-wg-call-9)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\u{1f449}[NEP-540](https://github.com/near/NEPs/issues/540) addresses the pressing issue of the storage staking mechanism\\\\\\'s inefficiency and the significant increase in costs due to the rise in NEAR token price. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\u{1f449}While [NEP-536](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/536) seeks to enhance protocol efficiency by reducing the number of gas refund receipts and optimizing gas usage within the Near ecosystem. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThese NEP\\\\\\'s are in the final comment period. Dive into the technical details in the GitHub discussion and join the call to learn about the final decision!\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"body": {"name": "NEAR Campus Challenge: Workshops and Ideathon-to-Hackathon Series ", "summary": "The NEAR Campus Challenge empowers Kenyan university students through workshops, ideathons, and a final hackathon focused on NEAR Protocol. This series will enhance practical blockchain skills, foster innovation, and grow the NEAR developer community by introducing fresh, talented developers ready to build on NEAR\\\\\\'s unique capabilities.\\\\n\\\\n", "category": "Universities & Bootcamps", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": null, "description": "**Event Introduction**\\\\n\\\\nNEAR Campus Challenge: Workshops and Ideathon-to-Hackathon Series in Kenya is a comprehensive series designed to immerse university students in the innovative world of NEAR Protocol. This series will kick off with engaging workshops at three prestigious universities in Kenya, where students will learn the fundamentals of blockchain and specifically how to utilize NEAR Protocol\\\\\\'s features for building decentralized applications. Following the workshops, each university will host an ideathon, challenging students to conceptualize and propose impactful projects using NEAR Protocol. Winners from these ideathons will advance to a competitive hackathon, where they will develop their projects with expert guidance and compete for prizes. This initiative targets not only computer science and engineering students but also developers and tech enthusiasts eager to explore blockchain technology\\\\\\'s potential.\\\\n\\\\n**Organizer Introduction**\\\\n\\\\nCryptoGalaxy is organized by a dedicated team of blockchain enthusiasts and professionals committed to advancing blockchain technology in Kenya and across Africa. Our team brings a diverse range of expertise and experience to the NEAR Campus Challenge:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n1.Victor Gunga is a passionate community advocate for Arbitrum and Graph Protocol. His experience includes hosting the Arbitrum campus tours and coordinating hackathons, significantly contributing to the growth and engagement of the blockchain developer community. \\\\nLinkedIn : https://www.linkedin.com/in/victorgunga/\\\\nTwitter: https://twitter.com/vicgunga\\\\n\\\\n2.Zuhura Kimani is the founder of LedgerLady, a community organization dedicated to empowering women through blockchain education. She has been instrumental in onboarding women into Web3, providing them with necessary resources and educational materials. Zuhura has extensive experience hosting events for major blockchain platforms such as Arbitrum, TON, and Solana. \\\\nLinkedIn : https://www.linkedin.com/in/zuhura-kimani-1a192927a/\\\\n Twitter: https://twitter.com/ledgerlady_\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n3.Nashons Agate is at the forefront of blockchain application in financial solutions, currently leading the development of Nexuspay, a stablecoin-based payment system for African countries. Nashons has a strong background in community building, having successfully hosted the Flow meetup in Kenya. \\\\nLinkedIn : https://www.linkedin.com/in/nashons-agate-165683226/\\\\n Twitter: https://twitter.com/agatenash\\\\n\\\\n**Previous Events\\\\n**\\\\nArbitrum Nairobi Meetup\\\\nLink: https://twitter.com/vicgunga/status/1764269130021040160?t=qxpLKuWTO1PrzGkO2BGT0Q&s=19\\\\nAttendance: 84\\\\nSponsor: Arbitrum Foundation\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nSolana Nairobi Meetup\\\\nLink: https://twitter.com/vicgunga/status/1771829710969802907?t=JGu81UqI5I58MbWlDY7svQ&s=19\\\\nAttendance: 42\\\\nSponsor: Solana Foundation\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nICP Zetech University Meetup\\\\nLink: https://twitter.com/cryptogalaxy254/status/1730923908612694351?t=BDQVYSZdjywU9K86znhF0g&s=19\\\\nAttendance: 117\\\\nSponsor: ICP\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nChainlink Smartcon Watchparty 2023\\\\nLink: https://twitter.com/doyeninit/status/1711734406291845444?t=TSkwJ651Mat6InYAYXdjYA&s=19\\\\nAttendance: 30\\\\nSponsor: Chainlink\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nGnosis Nairobi Meetup\\\\nLink: https://twitter.com/GriffinOduol/status/1673251261498507264?t=kxXG4NWn0C2PYw7iuOAZRQ&s=19\\\\nAttendance: 50\\\\nSponsor: Gnosis Builders\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nGnosis Ethsafari Side Event\\\\nLink: https://twitter.com/W3E_Kenyan/status/1706240688307007770?t=lb6-qrsHgwA-5TU_8BNdNg&s=19\\\\nAttendance: 96\\\\nSponsor: Gnosis Builders\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nGnosis Builders Kenya Hackathon\\\\nLink: https://twitter.com/W3E_Kenyan/status/1686255071862878209?t=VOmggozRhP8Mja9KZHYnEw&s=19\\\\nAttendance: 23\\\\nSponsor: Gnosis Builders\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nFlow Nairobi Meetup\\\\nLink: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1-2TbDFBpnapIwVmq36MNR2zea0L8619h?usp=sharing\\\\nAttendance: 88\\\\nSponsor: Flow\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nTON Nairobi Meetup\\\\nLink: https://twitter.com/ledgerlady_/status/1771461104343888340?t=KrBPtk9spD9KHgw7uoMH1A&s=19\\\\nAttendance: 79\\\\nSponsor: TON foundation\\\\n\\\\n**Event Impact**\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nThe NEAR Campus Challenge is specifically designed to catalyze the growth and development of future blockchain professionals in Kenya. By focusing on NEAR Protocol, this event series aims to achieve several impactful outcomes:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nDeveloper Skill Enhancement: Through comprehensive workshops and ideathons, participants will gain hands-on experience with NEAR Protocol\\\\\\'s technology. This includes understanding and utilizing its unique features such as sharding for scalability, low transaction fees, and a user-friendly development environment. These skills are crucial for building efficient and innovative decentralized applications.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nFostering Innovation: The event encourages students to think creatively about the applications of blockchain technology. By engaging in project-based learning and competitive development, participants will be equipped to contribute original ideas and solutions to the NEAR ecosystem, potentially leading to breakthroughs in blockchain application.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nCommunity Building: By bringing together students from various universities, the event will foster a strong community of NEAR developers in Kenya. This network will support ongoing collaboration and shared learning, strengthening the local blockchain ecosystem and ensuring sustained engagement with NEAR Protocol.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nCareer Opportunities: Participants will gain visibility among leading companies and startups within the blockchain industry. The practical experience and networking opportunities provided by the event can open doors to internships, job offers, and collaborative projects, accelerating professional growth in the technology sector.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nEnhancing NEAR Protocol\\\\\\'s Reach: As participants learn to develop on NEAR, they will naturally expand the protocol\\\\u{2019}s adoption and utilization, contributing to its growth and the diversification of its applications. This helps fulfill NEAR\\\\u{2019}s mission of empowering people with accessible, scalable, and user-friendly blockchain solutions.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)\\\\n**\\\\n\\\\nParticipant Engagement:\\\\nTotal Attendees: Aim to engage at least 800 participants across all events, including workshops, ideathons, and the hackathon.\\\\nActive Developers: Register a minimum of 200 students actively participating in the development challenges and submitting projects.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nEducational Outcomes:\\\\nWorkshop Completion: Ensure at least 80% of participants complete the workshop series, gauged through post-workshop assessments.\\\\n\\\\nInnovation and Project Development:\\\\nProjects Submitted: Target the submission of at least 50 distinct projects that utilize NEAR Protocol\\\\\\'s technology.\\\\nQuality Projects: Have at least 10 projects qualify for potential incubation or further development support by NEAR or associated partners.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nCommunity Impact:\\\\nNew NEAR Accounts: Creation of at least 300 new NEAR wallet accounts by participants.\\\\nOngoing Community Engagement: Establish a follow-up program where at least 50% of the participants continue engaging with the NEAR community through forums, subsequent events, or NEAR-related projects.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nFeedback and Satisfaction:\\\\nParticipant Satisfaction Rate: Achieve a participant satisfaction rate of 85% or higher, measured through post-event surveys.\\\\nPartner Feedback: Collect and evaluate positive feedback from sponsors and partners involved in the event.\\\\n\\\\n**Evaluation Factors**\\\\nProjects will be assessed based on:\\\\n\\\\nIntegration and innovative use of NEAR Protocol\\\\u{2019}s features.\\\\nTeam diversity and effectiveness.\\\\nMarket potential and alignment with blockchain trends.\\\\nTechnical proficiency and execution.\\\\nScalability and potential for real-world application.\\\\n\\\\n**Budget Breakdown**\\\\nWorkshop Budget (Per Campus):\\\\nSpace: $200\\\\nFood: $400\\\\nInternet: $50\\\\nPhotography: $100\\\\nBanners and Event Material: $150\\\\nAudio Visual: $100\\\\nTotal per Campus: $1000\\\\nTotal for 3 Campuses: $3000\\\\n\\\\nHackathon Budget:\\\\nSpace: $400\\\\nFood: $450\\\\nInternet: $50\\\\nPhotography: $100\\\\nBanners and Event Material: $150\\\\nAudio Visual: $150\\\\nTotal for Hackathon: $1300\\\\n\\\\nRewards and Stipends:\\\\nIdeathon Rewards: $600 per university x 3 = $1800\\\\nHackathon Rewards: $3000\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nGrand Total: $9,100\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "vicgunga.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "9100", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}

This series will enhance practical blockchain skills, foster innovation, and grow the NEAR developer community by introducing fresh, talented developers ready to build on NEAR\\\\\\'s unique capabilities.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=61)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

Or replay on [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@NEARDevHub)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}", "notify": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"neardevhub\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"mention\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"item\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"social\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"path\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"neardevnews.community.devhub.near/post/main\\\\\\\"}}}"}}, "handle": "neardevnews"}

{"body": {"name": "UI is Near: A plug-and-play component library unlocking seamless design for NEAR", "summary": "The Open Web and NEAR BOS adoption can be accelerated through faster, more efficient, and visually appealing development upgrades with UI is Near.\\\\n\\\\nThis project liberates devs from the noise of all the scattered information and documentation for the tedious tasks of styling basic components, allowing them to concentrate on the essential aspects of their project, especially when they are under a tight schedule. ", "category": "Other", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "frol.near", "description": "**This proposal has been revised and expectations have been aligned offline with DevHub team. Reference to first proposal here:** https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=post&id=3043 \\\\n\\\\n## Overview:\\\\n\\\\nUI is Near is not just a repository; it\\\\\\'s the go-to destination for unlocking a world of effortless design solutions for NEAR BOS. This project is designed to redefine the development experience by providing a comprehensive plug-and-play component library with crystal-clear documentation and thus, ease the entry barrier for new developers during hackathons and other onboarding activities, projects and events and also improve the development process for seasoned NEAR devs.\\\\n\\\\n## Motivation:\\\\n\\\\n**Our Motivation:**\\\\n\\\\nAs active participants in numerous hackathons and contributors to NEAR\\\\\\'s thriving ecosystem, we couldn\\\\\\'t help but notice a shared sentiment within the developer community. We listened attentively to their discussions about NEAR, absorbing all the feels: their insights, frustrations, and aspirations. What did we find out? Despite the innovative potential and promising bounties offered by NEAR, some developers would stay on the fence.\\\\n\\\\nThat\\\\u{2019}s when it hit us, everyone\\\\\\'s facing this same challenge: too much information, scattered and little to no clue of where to start. So we said, \\\\u{201c}They need something slick, easy, like a plug-and-play magic wand for developing, let\\\\\\'s make NEAR a no-brainer for every dev out there, from the code wizard to the hackathon hero!\\\\u{201d}. This is how the idea for UI is Near was born.\\\\n\\\\nUI is Near serves as a solution crafted by developers for developers, driven by a genuine passion for making NEAR an irresistible choice for every developer, hackathon enthusiast, and project pioneer who want to build for the Open Web.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**A She is Near + Dev Hub initiative:**\\\\n\\\\nBuilt by the community of She is Near in collaboration with Dev Hub, UI is Near is our initiative for the NEAR Ecosystem. \\\\n\\\\nThis project aligns with both She is Near and NEAR Dev Hub core values and goals of onboarding new devs into the ecosystem and increasing retention while fostering an inclusive and supportive developer community that includes women of all backgrounds.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Key Features:\\\\n\\\\nWith a \\\\u{201c}for dummies\\\\u{201d} approach, we want to show devs how the components were built and also facilitate their styling. In other words, create the type of libraries that already exist in Web2 to facilitate onboarding and continuous work on Web3. A developer\\\\u{2019}s dream.\\\\n\\\\nEntry point for Devs: UI is Near allows devs new to Near, whether at hackathons or other projects, programs or events, to focus on what matters most, accelerating the development process and enabling them to bring their ideas to life swiftly.\\\\n\\\\nCustom Designed Components: Accessible and customizable UI is Near will offer 37 components designed to facilitate and enhance the visual appeal and functionality of front-ends built on BOS.\\\\n\\\\n## These components are:\\\\n\\\\naccordion\\\\nalert-dialog\\\\nalert\\\\naspect-ratio\\\\navatar\\\\nbadge\\\\nbutton\\\\ncard\\\\ncheckbox\\\\ncollapsible\\\\ncontext-menu\\\\ndialog\\\\ndropdown-menu\\\\nhover-card\\\\ninput\\\\nlabel\\\\nmenubar\\\\nnavigation-menu\\\\npagination\\\\npopover\\\\nprogress\\\\nradio-group\\\\nscroll-area\\\\nselect\\\\nseparator\\\\nsheet\\\\nskeleton\\\\nslider\\\\nswitch\\\\ntable\\\\ntabs\\\\ntextarea\\\\ntoast\\\\ntoaster\\\\ntoggle-group\\\\ntoggle\\\\ntooltip\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**Crystal-Clear Documentation:** UI is Near will be accompanied by detailed and user-friendly documentation, providing developers with comments on how the code works and how to use it. \\\\n\\\\n**Effortless Integration:** UI is Near will ensure a seamless integration process, reducing development time and eliminating repetitive tasks. As simple as importing a ready-to-use component into a project, or have the possibility to copy/paste the code to customize at will. \\\\n\\\\n**CSS Framework:** In addition to the usual way of using CSS in the current NEAR BOS components, Tailwind CSS will be added to these new components. The new components may be styled in any way people want by taking advantage of the features of Tailwind CSS.\\\\n\\\\n**Components like shadcn/ui:** Lately, the favorite tool of developers for the creation/utilization of components has been shadcn. That is why we decided to ease this learning and usability curve by bringing the same perspective that shadcn uses for its components.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Timeline:\\\\n\\\\nThe project is anticipated to span 3-4 weeks\\\\n\\\\n**Milestones:**\\\\nWork on the 37 components \\\\nCreate Github repository\\\\nCreate examples for documentation\\\\nTesting of components\\\\nIntegrating of components in the documentation\\\\nSend to Dev Hub for test run before going live\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**Deliverables:**\\\\n37 components ready to use\\\\nDocumentation for each component\\\\nShare Github with Dev Hub\\\\n\\\\n## The Team:\\\\n\\\\n**Gonzalo - Web2 Developer**\\\\n\\\\nAs a seasoned Full-Stack Developer with over 20 years of experience, I\\\\\\'ve cultivated a strong technical foundation, specializing in client-side and server-side programming, SQL database design and REST API development. I entered the blockchain space in 2023 through Alchemy University. I then participated (and won) in hackathons such as Eth Barcelona and Eth Global Istanbul, this last one with NEAR. Beyond technical skills, I possess a deep understanding of collaborative team dynamics and a commitment to delivering quality results. My journey involves a unique blend of technical expertise, marketing, and branding, acquired through self-driven learning over the past decade. I want to support the initiative by She is Near because I think it is a great project and a tool I would have liked to have during my participation at the hackathon. This is going to help many developers to enter Web3 and use NEAR. \\\\n\\\\nGithub:  https://github.com/gonzalobarria \\\\nTelegram: https://t.me/dientelargo\\\\n\\\\n**Budget for Technical Development:** \\\\n\\\\nDaily hours                  8\\\\nDays                             5\\\\nTotal per week             40\\\\nWeeks                          3,5\\\\nTOTAL Project (hours)  140\\\\nCost per hou                43\\\\nTotal Cost                     6020\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**Waleska - Project Manager**\\\\n\\\\nI\\\\u{2019}m an entrepreneur with proficiency in diverse disciplines, spanning from Arts and Human Development to Technology and AI. In 2023, I co-founded Block&Change, an impact movement to bridge knowledge and opportunities in blockchain and Web3 between the Hispanic community and the English-speaking world. A fervent advocate for financial literacy, particularly for women and disadvantaged groups, I have earned recognition as one of the leading voices in LATAM for online microlearning education for over a decade. I have joined She is Near to propel and support the inclusion and growth of women devs into the ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\nLinked In: https://www.linkedin.com/in/waleskacerpa/   \\\\nTelegram: https://t.me/IamTiche\\\\n\\\\n**Budget: (PM covered by she is near)**\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "iamwal.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "6020", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": []}
